title: 159th Anniversary of Sri Lanka Police falls today
byline: The 159th Anniversary of the Sri Lanka Police will be celebrated today (03).

title: One dead, another injured in Central Expressway accident
byline: An individual has died while another person has sustained injuries in an accident along the Central Expressway earlier today (03), police stated.

title: At least 25 killed in Pakistan attacks, including 14 at political rally
byline: At least 25 people were killed in three attacks in Pakistan on Tuesday, officials said, including 14 who died after a suicide bomber targeted a political rally in the southwestern province of Balochistan.

title: Few showers expected in parts of the island today
byline: A few showers are expected in the Western and Sabaragamuwa provinces and in the Galle, Matara, Kandy, and Nuwara-Eliya districts today (03), according to the Department of Meteorology.

title: Asian Karate dream of Sri Lankan athletes shattered due to visa issues
byline: Sri Lankan karate athletes who were scheduled to depart the island yesterday (02) to participate in the 23rd Asian Karate Championship in China were unable to travel due to not receiving their visas.

title: China to hold massive parade to mark WWII victory
byline: China will hold a massive military parade in central Beijing on Wednesday to mark the 80th anniversary of its victory in World War II, pledging its commitment to peaceful development in a world still fraught with turbulence and uncertainties.

title: Donald Trump rejects that China posing challenge to US on world stage
byline: Donald Trump has rejected suggestions that the warming of relations between China, Russia and their allies poses a challenge to the US on the global stage.

title: Paramount to make live-action Call of Duty movie
byline: Paramount, the Hollywood studio recently acquired by the software billionaire Ellison family, will make a movie based on the wildly popular Call of Duty video games, it announced Tuesday (Sep 2).

title: President pledges to launch series of new development projects this month
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake says the incumbent government’s objective is to drive national development through a structured plan that recognises economic strengths and brings economic growth to rural areas.

title: Ex-Minister Rajitha Senaratne at Bribery Commission
byline: Former Minister Rajitha Senaratne, who is currently in remand custody has been presented before the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC).

title: Two suspects arrested in connection with shootings in two areas
byline: Two individuals have been apprehended in connection with shooting incidents that occurred in two separate areas, police stated.

title: China holds massive parade to mark 80th anniversary of WWII victory
byline: China held a massive military parade in central Beijing on Wednesday to mark the 80th anniversary of its victory in World War II, pledging the country’s commitment to peaceful development in a world still fraught with turbulence and uncertainties.

title: Death toll in Central Expressway accident increases two
byline: Another person who sustained injuries in the accident reported along the Central Expressway has succumbed, police stated.

title: Deputy Foreign Minister of Italy to arrive in Sri Lanka today
byline: The Deputy Minister for Foreign Affairs of Italy, Maria Tripodi, is scheduled to arrive in the island on an official visit today (03).

title: Inaugural session of Tourism Promotion Task Force held
byline: The inaugural session of the Tourism Promotion Task Force was held at the Presidential Secretariat yesterday, the President’s Media Division said.

title: Fire breaks out in Buttala Yudaganawa mountain reserve
byline: A fire has broken out in the Yudaganawa-Puhulagala mountain reserve, in Buttala.

title: Individual injured in shooting reported in Maligawatte
byline: A shooting has been reported along the Jummah Masjid Road in Maligawatte this morning (03), police stated.

title: Ex- IGP Pujith Jayasundara released in case filed over alleged assault of lift operator
byline: The Colombo Fort Magistrate’s Court today (03) ordered the release of former Inspector General of Police Pujith Jayasundara from the case filed over the alleged assault of a lift operator at the Police Headquarters.

title: UK looks to ban sale of high-caffeine energy drinks to under-16s
byline: The UK government has proposed banning the sale of high-caffeine energy drinks to youths under 16 years of age in shops, restaurants, cafes and vending machines, as well as via online retailers.

title: Man arrested with 2.7kg of heroin in Walasmulla
byline: An individual has been arrested with 2 kilograms and 755 grams of heroin in Walasmulla, police stated.

title: New quake shakes devastated Afghan region as death toll exceeds 1,400
byline: An earthquake of magnitude 5.5 shook southeastern Afghanistan on Tuesday, sparking fears of further damage and destruction almost two days after a large quake in the same region killed more than 1,400 people and injured thousands more.

title: Alphabet shares jump as US court ruling eases antitrust concerns
byline: Google-parent Alphabet surged 6 per cent in premarket trading on Wednesday after a US federal judge spared the company from a forced breakup in an antitrust case, marking a pivotal moment for the tech giant whose dominance in search and mobile ecosystems has long drawn scrutiny.

title: Customs agrees to release 506 BYD electric vehicles
byline: Sri Lanka Customs today (03) gave an undertaking to the Court of Appeal that it will release a total of 506 detained BYD electric vehicles, subject to the submission of additional bank guarantees.

title: Former Minister Rajitha leaves Bribery Commission
byline: Former Minister Rajitha Senaratne, who is currently in remand custody, has left the Bribery Commission a short while ago after recording a statement for nearly five hours.

title: Customs seizes narcotics worth Rs. 312 million sent via courier parcels
byline: A large consignment of narcotics valued at Rs. 312 million was seized this afternoon (3) by officers of the Sri Lanka Customs’ Narcotics Control Division after being detected in courier parcels received through airmail at a private bonded warehouse in Seeduwa, Katunayake.

title: Speaker endorses certificate on Gambling Regulatory Authority Bill
byline: The Speaker of Parliament Dr. Jagath Wickramaratne today (03) endorsed the certification on the Gambling Regulatory Authority Bill in accordance with Article 79 of the Constitution.

title: Deputy Foreign Minister of Italy arrives in Sri Lanka
byline: The Deputy Minister for Foreign Affairs of Italy, Maria Tripodi, has arrived in Sri Lanka today (03) on an official visit.

title: Death toll in Central Expressway accident increases to two
byline: Another person who sustained injuries in the accident reported along the Central Expressway has succumbed, police stated.

title: Over 1,600 illegal firearms taken into custody so far this year - IGP
byline: Sri Lanka’s Inspector General of Police (IGP) Priyantha Weerasuriya says that 1,612 illegal firearms have been taken into custody so far this year.

title: President AKD appoints 18 new High Court Judges
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has appointed 18 new Judges of the High Court.

title: Grade 5 Scholarship Exam results to be released tonight
byline: The results of the 2025 Grade 05 Scholarship Examination are scheduled to be released tonight (3), according to the Department of Examinations.

title: Negligent police officers must resign or be removed – President
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake emphasized that no crime should be concealed by the passage of time and that time will never be an obstacle in bringing criminals to justice.

title: Putin says he is ready to meet Zelenskiy if he comes to Moscow
byline: Russian President Vladimir Putin said on Wednesday that he was ready to hold talks with Volodymyr Zelenskiy if the Ukrainian president came to Moscow, but said it remained to be seen whether such a meeting was worthwhile.
